name: Ada Lovelace
description: First person to recognize that computers could do more than just calculations. Wrote the first algorithm meant to be processed by a machine.

name: Alan Turing
description: Father of theoretical computer science and artificial intelligence. Created the Turing machine concept and broke the Enigma code.

name: Grace Hopper
description: Invented the first compiler and instrumental in developing COBOL. Pioneered machine-independent programming languages.

name: Linus Torvalds
description: Created Linux kernel and Git. Changed open source forever and gave us the foundation of modern cloud computing.

name: Tim Berners-Lee
description: Invented the World Wide Web. Created HTTP, HTML, and laid the foundation for the modern internet.

name: Donald Knuth
description: Wrote 'The Art of Computer Programming'. Pioneered the field of algorithm analysis and created TeX typesetting.

name: Dennis Ritchie
description: Created C programming language and co-developed Unix. His work influences nearly all modern software.

name: Margaret Hamilton
description: Lead developer for Apollo Guidance Computer software. Pioneered software engineering and system reliability.

name: Ken Thompson
description: Co-created Unix, invented B programming language (precursor to C), and created UTF-8 encoding.

name: Bjarne Stroustrup
description: Created C++ programming language, bringing object-oriented programming to C and revolutionizing software development.

name: John Carmack
description: Pioneered 3D graphics techniques and founded id Software. Created groundbreaking game engines and popularized first-person 3D games.

name: Guido van Rossum
description: Created Python programming language. Made programming more accessible with focus on readability and simplicity.

name: James Gosling
description: Created Java programming language. Brought 'Write Once, Run Anywhere' to software development.

name: Richard Stallman
description: Founded GNU Project and Free Software Foundation. Pioneer of the free software movement and copyleft licensing.

name: Vint Cerf
description: Co-invented TCP/IP protocols. Known as one of the 'Fathers of the Internet' for his fundamental contributions.

name: Brendan Eich
description: Created JavaScript in 10 days. His work made dynamic web pages possible and revolutionized web development.

name: Anders Hejlsberg
description: Created Turbo Pascal, Delphi, C#, and TypeScript. Pioneered modern development tools and type systems.

name: Yukihiro Matsumoto
description: Created Ruby programming language. Focused on developer happiness and elegant code design.

name: John McCarthy
description: Invented Lisp programming language and coined the term 'Artificial Intelligence'. Pioneer of AI research.

name: Douglas Engelbart
description: Invented the computer mouse and pioneered human-computer interaction. Demonstrated the first hypertext system.

name: Bill Joy
description: Co-founded Sun Microsystems. Created vi editor and contributed significantly to BSD Unix and Java.

name: Ward Cunningham
description: Invented the wiki. Pioneered patterns in programming and Extreme Programming practices.

name: Larry Wall
description: Created Perl programming language. Revolutionized text processing and system administration.

name: Barbara Liskov
description: Developed Liskov Substitution Principle and invented abstract data types. Pioneer in programming language design.

name: Tony Hoare
description: Invented QuickSort algorithm and pioneered formal verification. Also known for null reference (his 'billion-dollar mistake').

name: Martin Fowler
description: Pioneered software patterns, refactoring, and agile methodologies. Influential in software architecture and design.

name: Rasmus Lerdorf
description: Created PHP programming language. Helped shape modern web development and server-side scripting.

name: Rob Pike
description: Co-created Go programming language, UTF-8, and Plan 9 OS. Significant contributions to Unix development.

name: Niklaus Wirth
description: Created Pascal, Modula, and Oberon languages. Pioneer in programming language design and computer architecture.

name: Jeff Dean
description: Key architect of Google's distributed computing infrastructure. Pioneer in large-scale distributed systems.

name: Evan You
description: Created Vue.js framework and Vite build tool. Revolutionized reactive frontend development with an approachable progressive framework.

name: Rich Harris
description: Created Svelte framework and Rollup bundler. Pioneered compile-time reactivity and modern build tooling.

name: Ryan Dahl
description: Created Node.js and Deno. Brought JavaScript to server-side development and later improved upon it with Deno.

name: Jordan Walke
description: Created React.js at Facebook. Introduced virtual DOM and component-based UI development that transformed web development.

name: Leslie Lamport
description: Developed LaTeX and fundamental distributed systems concepts. Created temporal logic of actions (TLA) for system verification.

name: Katherine Johnson
description: NASA mathematician whose calculations were crucial for early space missions. Pioneered use of computers for space flight calculations.

name: Chris Lattner
description: Created LLVM compiler infrastructure and Swift programming language. Revolutionized compiler optimization and tooling.

name: Graydon Hoare
description: Created Rust programming language at Mozilla. Introduced new paradigms for memory safety and concurrent programming.

name: Steve Wozniak
description: Co-founded Apple and designed Apple I and II computers. Pioneer in personal computing and hardware design.

name: Brad Fitzpatrick
description: Created LiveJournal and Memcached. Pioneer in scalable web applications and distributed caching.

name: James Clark
description: Created XML, SGML tools, and significant contributions to HTML/web standards. Pioneer in markup languages and technical documentation systems.

name: Joe Armstrong
description: Created Erlang programming language. Pioneer in fault-tolerant distributed systems and actor model implementation.

name: David Heinemeier Hansson (DHH)
description: Created Ruby on Rails framework, revolutionizing web development with 'convention over configuration'.

name: Igor Sysoev
description: Created Nginx web server. Revolutionized web server architecture and performance, powering a significant portion of the internet.

name: Robert Griesemer
description: Co-created Go programming language and worked on V8 JavaScript engine. Major contributions to programming language design and implementation.

name: John Backus
description: Created FORTRAN, the first widely-used high-level programming language. Led development of ALGOL and invented Backus-Naur Form (BNF) notation for describing programming language syntax.

name: Betty Holberton
description: One of the six original ENIAC programmers. Created Sort-Merge generator, helped design COBOL and FORTRAN, and developed early standards for numerical analysis and computation.

name: Jean Sammet
description: Created FORMAC (FORmula MAnipulation Compiler), the first widely used computer language for symbolic mathematics. Key developer of COBOL and pioneered the history of programming languages.

name: Michael Stonebraker
description: Pioneer in database systems, created Ingres and PostgreSQL. Founded numerous database companies and developed fundamental concepts in relational and non-relational databases. His work spans from early relational systems to modern distributed databases.

name: Edgar F. Codd
description: Invented the relational model for database management, which revolutionized database design and led to SQL. His '12 rules' defined relational databases and changed how we store and retrieve data.

name: Bob Kahn
description: Co-invented TCP/IP protocols with Vint Cerf, establishing the fundamental communication architecture of the Internet. Pioneer in packet-switching technology and internet standardization.

name: Ivan Sutherland
description: Created Sketchpad, the first graphical user interface and computer-aided design program. Pioneer in computer graphics, virtual reality, and object-oriented programming concepts.

name: Jonathan Gay
description: Created Flash (originally FutureSplash Animator), revolutionizing web animation and interactive content. His work enabled rich internet applications and web-based games.

name: Ray Kurzweil
description: Invented first CCD flatbed scanner, first print-to-speech reading machine for the blind, and first commercial text-to-speech synthesizer. Pioneer in optical character recognition and AI applications.

name: Butler Lampson
description: Fundamental contributions to personal computing, including GUIs, word processing, networks, and operating systems. Led development of Alto at Xerox PARC, which inspired modern PCs.

name: Peter Naur
description: Co-created Backus-Naur Form (BNF) notation, contributed significantly to ALGOL 60 development, and pioneered software engineering concepts. Influenced programming language design fundamentals.

name: Paul Allen
description: Co-founded Microsoft and created Microsoft BASIC, the foundational programming language for early personal computers. Pioneered microcomputer software development and helped establish the PC software industry.

name: Theo de Raadt
description: Created OpenBSD and OpenSSH, setting new standards for security-focused operating systems and secure network communication. His emphasis on security and code correctness influenced modern security practices.

name: Matthias Ettrich
description: Created KDE desktop environment and initiated Qt development for Linux. Revolutionized Linux user interfaces and desktop applications, making Linux more accessible to everyday users.

name: Roy Fielding
description: Defined REST architectural style, co-founded Apache HTTP Server project, and principal author of HTTP/1.1 protocol. His work forms the theoretical foundation of modern web architecture.

name: Jim Gray
description: Pioneer in database and transaction processing systems. Developed fundamental concepts in transaction processing, recovery, and distributed database systems. Turing Award winner who revolutionized how we handle data.

name: Taylor Otwell
description: Created Laravel, the most popular PHP framework, revolutionizing modern PHP development. Developed key tools like Forge, Envoyer, and Vapor, making PHP deployment and development more accessible and robust.

name: Rich Hickey
description: Created Clojure programming language, bringing modern Lisp to the JVM. Pioneered innovative concepts in functional programming and immutable data structures. His emphasis on simplicity and immutability influenced modern software design.

name: Martin Odersky
description: Created Scala programming language and contributed to Java generics. Combined object-oriented and functional programming, significantly influencing big data processing and concurrent programming.

name: Jos√© Valim
description: Created Elixir programming language, building on Erlang's foundation to create a modern, functional language focused on scalability and maintainability. Pioneer in concurrent programming and fault-tolerant systems.

name: Roberto Ierusalimschy
description: Created Lua programming language, which became the leading scripting language in game development. Pioneered lightweight, embeddable language design with unique features like coroutines and metatables.

name: Phil Wadler
description: Key contributor to Haskell language design and Java generics. Pioneer in functional programming theory, introduced monads to functional programming, and developed the concept of type classes.

name: Walter Bright
description: Created D programming language and the first native C++ compiler for DOS. Combined systems programming capabilities with modern language features, influencing low-level programming language design.

name: Jeremy Ashkenas
description: Created CoffeeScript and Backbone.js. His work influenced JavaScript development and MVC frameworks, paving the way for modern JavaScript syntax and frameworks.

name: Cleve Moler
description: Created MATLAB, revolutionizing numerical computing and technical computing. His work made matrix manipulation and scientific computing accessible to engineers and scientists worldwide.

name: Alan Kay
description: Created Smalltalk and pioneered object-oriented programming. Developed the concept of personal computing and graphical user interfaces at Xerox PARC. His vision of 'the computer as we know it today' shaped modern computing.

name: Robin Milner
description: Created ML programming language and pioneered type inference. Developed theoretical foundations for concurrent systems with CCS and pi-calculus. Turing Award winner who revolutionized type systems.

name: Guy Steele
description: Co-created Scheme, contributed to Common Lisp, and developed early specifications for Java. Pioneer in programming language design and parallel computing languages. Led development of Fortress.

name: Gerald Jay Sussman
description: Co-created Scheme with Guy Steele. Developed the SICP curriculum and wrote 'Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs'. Pioneer in AI and computational physics.

name: Stephen Wolfram
description: Created Mathematica and the Wolfram Language. Pioneer in computational science and complex systems. His work revolutionized symbolic computation and technical computing.

name: Xavier Leroy
description: Created OCaml programming language and the CompCert verified C compiler. Pioneer in type systems, functional programming, and formal verification of critical software.

name: Nathaniel Rochester
description: Created the first assembler for IBM 701. Pioneer in computer organization and early programming languages. Key figure in early IBM computer development.

name: Ken Kennedy
description: Created High Performance Fortran (HPF). Pioneer in optimizing compilers and high-performance computing. Founded Rice University's computer science program.

name: Simon Peyton Jones
description: Key architect of Haskell and the Glasgow Haskell Compiler (GHC). Pioneer in functional programming implementation and language design. Major contributor to lazy evaluation techniques.

name: Tom Christiansen
description: Major contributor to Perl language development and documentation. Created Perl core modules and wrote influential Perl books. Pioneer in making Perl accessible and practical.

name: Chris Granger
description: Created Light Table IDE and Eve programming language. Pioneer in modern programming environments and live programming interfaces. Influenced modern development tools.

name: Alain Colmerauer
description: Created Prolog programming language. Pioneer in logic programming and computational linguistics. His work revolutionized artificial intelligence and expert systems.

name: John G. Kemeny
description: Co-created BASIC programming language at Dartmouth. Made computing accessible to non-specialists and pioneered computer education. President of Dartmouth College.

name: Thomas E. Kurtz
description: Co-created BASIC programming language with John Kemeny. Pioneer in making computing accessible to students and non-specialists. Developed the Dartmouth Time Sharing System.

name: William Shockley
description: Co-invented the transistor at Bell Labs, revolutionizing electronics and making modern computing possible. Founded Shockley Semiconductor Laboratory, which led to Silicon Valley's creation.

name: John Bardeen
description: Co-invented the transistor at Bell Labs. Only person to win two Nobel Prizes in Physics, one for the transistor and one for superconductivity theory. His work enabled the digital revolution.

name: Walter Brattain
description: Co-invented the transistor at Bell Labs with Shockley and Bardeen. Key contributor to semiconductor physics and surface states theory. His experimental work was crucial to the transistor's development.

name: Gordon Moore
description: Co-founded Intel and formulated Moore's Law. Pioneer in semiconductor manufacturing and integrated circuits. His prediction about transistor density guided the semiconductor industry for decades.

name: Sindre Sorhus
description: Most starred developer on GitHub with over 750,000 stars. Created hundreds of influential open source tools and libraries including Yeoman, AVA, and Got. Pioneer in modern open source development practices and JavaScript tooling. His packages are downloaded billions of times monthly.

name: Lars Bak
description: Created Dart programming language and V8 JavaScript engine. Pioneer in virtual machine technology, having worked on Self, Strongtalk, HotSpot (Java VM), V8, and Dart VM. His work revolutionized dynamic language performance.

name: Michael Widenius
description: Created MySQL, the world's most popular open source database, and MariaDB. His work democratized database access and powered much of the early web. Pioneer in open source database development.

name: Charles Bachman
description: Created the first database management system (IDS) and the Integrated Data Store. Turing Award winner who pioneered database concepts and invented the first DBMS. His work laid foundation for modern databases.

name: Arthur Whitney
description: Created K programming language and kdb+. Pioneer in array programming and high-performance financial computing. His work revolutionized time-series databases and financial analytics.

name: Chuck Moore
description: Created Forth programming language and pioneered stack-based computing. His minimalist approach influenced programming language design and embedded systems. Invented colorForth and machine-specific optimizations.

name: Aaron Swartz
description: Co-authored RSS specification, co-founded Reddit, and created web.py framework. Pioneer in web technologies and open access advocacy. His work on information freedom influenced modern internet culture.

name: Fabrice Bellard
description: Created QEMU, FFmpeg, TinyCC, QuickJS, and BPG. Programming polymath who revolutionized emulation, multimedia processing, and JavaScript engines. His tools are fundamental to modern computing infrastructure.
